body: If user.id is sharding key, you should explicitly set user.id=1234 to let sql parser know how to shard. A parser don't know a deep calculation such as a=b and b=1234.

> Now we know getNString is unnecessary for Oracle&Sqlserver[1].
> I found in MySQL-jdbc driver, getNString is wrapping a getString[2],
> In PGSQL-jdbc driver, getNString(int) is not supported, but getNString(String) is wrapping getString too[3].
> 
> ```
>  public String getNString(int columnIndex) throws SQLException {
>     connection.getLogger().log(Level.FINEST, "  getNString columnIndex: {0}", columnIndex);
>     throw org.postgresql.Driver.notImplemented(this.getClass(), "getNString(int)");
>   }
> 
>   public String getNString(String columnName) throws SQLException {
>     return getNString(findColumn(columnName));
>   }
> ```
> 
> So it's the same for all of them(MySQL/PGSQL/SQLServer/Oracle).
> Further more, getNString is added since jdbc-4.0/jdk6, so every jdbc-driver keep it the same of getString to compatible with jdbc-3.0/jdk5.
> And then, we can fix it now.
> 
> [1].https://kb.kutu66.com/java/post_1436975
> [2].https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-j/blob/release%2F5.1/src/com/mysql/jdbc/JDBC4ResultSet.java
> [3].https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/blob/fda4299e1e3b76aa7e0c0031f3e11c61dd05c64b/pgjdbc/src/main/java/org/postgresql/jdbc/PgResultSet.java#L3615

Yes, thanks for reply. 
I think  it's better for sharding-jdbc to supports jdbc4-api like getNString etc.

The above error message is that BigInteger cannot be converted to Long or Integer type, because the Long or Integer type supports mod operation(%), however BigInteger doesn't support it. The following is a typical error scenario, `shardingValue.getValue()` will always return BigInteger type value, and resulting in an error in mod operation:
```java
@Override
public String doSharding(final Collection<String> availableTargetNames, final PreciseShardingValue<Integer> shardingValue) {
    for (String each : availableTargetNames) {
        if (each.endsWith(String.valueOf(shardingValue.getValue() % 2))) {
            return each;
        }
    }
    return null;
}
```

> > spring.shardingsphere.max.connections.size.per.query =50 (or 100)
> > ```
> 
> Thank you for your patience, I will try

I guess it take effect.
If not, you can send us your ddl and we will be profiling and tunning it's loading.

You know, with a key generator, there will be added a key value to insert statement, and then shardingsphere will route insert statement to a certain database/table.

But without a key generator, there will be not a key value, so shardingsphere will not know how ti route this statement.

Partiallly agree with you about that getObject can return null.
In another hand, you can't modify the method return type with long or int.

So, check an int field is null via getObject or rs.wasNull to be a better way.
And now, Can you try to fix it?
